Looking at the jdk code, destroyForcibly issue a SIGKILL for *nix. So, I don't think this change would make any difference.
Also, this is *nix specific. If we are planning to support Windows, this will not work.

@maaquib :


We are aware about the destroyForcibly implementation, however it does not guarantee immediate action.


Replacing this with an independent process for sending a SIGKILL to the worker process ensures an immediate action.


We tested the installation script on m4.xlarge instance, where this issue is observed consistently,  in a 10 times loop and it failed every time for staging_0_1_1 branch and succeeded everytime with fix in this (issue_417) branch.
Please refer the newly attached logs in the main PR description.


I agree this is *nix specific fix, but works fine on Ubuntu and MacOS which we support currently. We can add a OS level check and prepare specific command whenever we want to support windows.
